summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative forms from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 12, 2019. It includes count sheets, inmate rosters, and out-count forms detailing inmate locations and assignments. The significance lies in it being routine prison documentation from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Daily Prison Counts
events.description: Routine inmate counts and out-counts were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations.context: Address of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), the federal prison where the documents were generated.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC)
locations.context: The federal detention facility where the inmate counts and rosters were recorded.

keyFacts: The documents are routine Bureau of Prisons administrative records (count sheets, rosters, out-count forms) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 12, 2019.
These records list numerous inmates by name, registration number, and housing unit assignment, but none are identified as Jeffrey Epstein or other key figures from his case.
The documents demonstrate the standard prison procedures for tracking inmate location and population, which is the context for facility management prior to Epstein's death.
Multiple forms are marked with 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG' or 'SUICIDE OR' in the assignment field for certain inmates, indicating special watch status.
The records show a total inmate population count of 762 across various housing units within the MCC on that date.
